meanings.definition: The quality or state of being puny.
meanings.sent1: Her puninesses made it difficult for her to lift heavy objects.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's puninesses made it adorable and endearing.
meanings.sent3: Despite his puninesses, he tried to carry the groceries inside.
meanings.sent4: The puninesses of the seedling were a stark contrast to the towering trees around it.
meanings.sent5: The puninesses of the toy car were evident when compared to the real vehicle.

meanings.definition: The condition of being small or weak in size or strength.
meanings.sent1: The puninesses of the ant made it easy to overlook in the grass.
meanings.sent2: The puninesses of the flashlight made it convenient to carry in a pocket.
meanings.sent3: The puninesses of the pencil sharpener made it a challenge to use.
meanings.sent4: The puninesses of the spider were no match for the shoe coming down on it.
meanings.sent5: The puninesses of the flower made it delicate and beautiful in the garden.
